subject: Programming
title: Memory and Storage Tradeoffs
description: A quick, practical guide to Memory and Storage Tradeoffs.

hook.text: You can make lookups instant â€” if you're willing to use more memory. Speed and space always trade.

buildup.text: Hash tables trade extra memory for near-instant lookups. Compressed structures save space but slow access.

discovery.text: Cache-friendly structures that fit in fast CPU memory outperform theoretically faster structures that don't.

twist.text: Modern hardware makes some textbook analyses wrong. Cache misses cost more than extra comparisons.

climax.text: The best structure depends not just on Big O but on the actual hardware your code runs on.

punchline.text: Theory says one thing. Hardware says another.

quiz.question: What is the main tradeoff in data structures?
